mode_of_transport: Sea and Inland Waterway Transport Only

data.brief: Seller delivers when goods pass the ship's rail (are loaded on board) at the named port of shipment.
data.risk_transfer_point: When goods are loaded on board the vessel at the port of shipment.

embedding_content: Incoterms 2020 FOB (Free On Board). Used for Sea transport only. Risk transfers to buyer once goods are loaded on board the vessel. Seller handles export customs; Buyer pays ocean freight and handles import.

data.brief: Seller bears all costs and risks involved in bringing the goods to the place of destination.
data.risk_transfer_point: When goods are placed at the disposal of the buyer, cleared for import, ready for unloading at the named place of destination.

seller_pays: Everything: Transport, Insurance, Export & Import Customs, Duties & Taxes
buyer_pays: Unloading cost at final destination (unless contract states otherwise)

seller_obligations.insurance: No obligation to buy, but seller bears all risk, so insurance is recommended.

embedding_content: Incoterms 2020 DDP (Delivered Duty Paid). Maximum obligation for the Seller. Seller pays for shipping, insurance, and IMPORT DUTIES/TAXES. Seller is responsible for import clearance.
